channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11742] Backport HBASE-7987 and HBASE-11185 to 0.98
item.description: HBASE-7987 improves how snapshots are handled via a manifest file. This requires reverting HBASE-11360 since introduces an alternate functionality that is not compatible with HBASE-7987.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
By applying the patch on 0.98 I get a param problem on the InputFormat constructor, which seems to be related to HBASE-11137


mapred/TableSnapshotInputFormat.java:[60,22] error: no suitable constructor found for InputSplit(String,List<String>)

mapreduce/TableSnapshotInputFormat.java:[113,22] error: no suitable constructor found for InputSplit(String,List<String>)

HBASE-11185 must be applied too.
and HBASE-11326 is a nice to have.

other then that looks ok to me, I'll take another look and play with it a later
I updated the description to include HBASE-11185, since it's required. We can put up a consolidated patch on this issue if you like.
Set fix version

Yeah, I'm fine having HBASE-11185 too in this patch if you think so but I guess it could be done on the same HBASE-11185 after backporting this (done it already in my local repo and it applies cleanly).
Fair enough, either way works, but might as well bundle them because we have the rationale for that documented by this issue.

New patch, includes HBASE-11185 as suggested by Andrew Purtell, also includes refactored InputSplit() method (missing from HBASE-11137) that fixes the issue that Matteo Bertozzi noticed. It should be clear that this patch reverts HBASE-11360 in order to support HBASE-7987 in the 0.98 branch.
https://reviews.apache.org/r/24826/
+1 looks good to me
Thanks Matteo Bertozzi. Andrew Purtell does it looks good for you?

What happens if there is an older client library that wants to run a MR-over snapshots job against snapshots dropped by newer servers? The older library will be looking for table descriptors and snapshot region names in the FS instead of SnapshotFileInfo/SnapshotRegionManifest.

Do we continue to handle TableSnapshotRegionSplit messages that have RegionSpecifiers (field #1) instead of the new TableSchema and RegionInfo fields (3 and 4)?

What happens if someone uses the newer client in a MR-over-snapshots job where there is no SnapshotFileInfo/SnapshotRegionManifest data available because the servers are older?

What happens when we have a mix of snapshots dropped by an older server side versus a newer server side?

What happens if there is an older client library that wants to run a MR-over snapshots job against snapshots dropped by newer servers? The older library will be looking for table descriptors and snapshot region names in the FS instead of SnapshotFileInfo/SnapshotRegionManifest.

you can't use old jars to read the new format.

Do we continue to handle TableSnapshotRegionSplit messages that have RegionSpecifiers (field #1) instead of the new TableSchema and RegionInfo fields (3 and 4)?

That proto is internal to the map reduce and used just for message passing, so there is no need for compatibility there. Unless you have different jars executing the mr job.

What happens if someone uses the newer client in a MR-over-snapshots job where there is no SnapshotFileInfo/SnapshotRegionManifest data available because the servers are older?

The new code is able to read the old format

What happens when we have a mix of snapshots dropped by an older server side versus a newer server side?

The new code support taking snapshot during rolling upgrades, which means that the older RS writes in the old format and the new one in the new format. Which is fine since both format are readable and aggregated on read if necessary (requires the new jars). If the master is already updates will do the merge of the RS result converting to the single manifest if necessary.

What happens if there is an older client library that wants to run a MR-over snapshots job against snapshots dropped by newer servers? The older library will be looking for table descriptors and snapshot region names in the FS instead of SnapshotFileInfo/SnapshotRegionManifest.

you can't use old jars to read the new format.

We can't force an upgrade of an older client with a minor server bump. The server side needs to support older clients until the client fleet can be upgraded independent of server side. Thanks for clarifying elsewhere, so this is the only issue with the current patch. Can we keep server side support for writing both formats with the backwards compatible option the default? Some new configuration setting will have a default of "false" (or "1"). We can add a release note describing the necessary steps to move to the improved functionality.

yeah, that should be easy. it just need a conf that set this property in SnapshotDescriptionUtil.java


public static final int SNAPSHOT_LAYOUT_VERSION = SnapshotManifestV2.DESCRIPTOR_VERSION;

let me do that

snapshot-format-conf.patch contains the conf property "hbase.snapshot.format.version" with the hbase-default set to 1.
Which basically produces the same results of before (0.94, 0.96)
switching the format.version to 2 you can still read old snapshots, but to read the new ones from MR over snapshots you need the new jars.

Ok, +1

I will commit the combined change set shortly unless there is an objection or additional feedback.
Great!, thanks Andrew Purtell and Matteo Bertozzi!
Pushed to 0.98.

Build on hadoop-1.1 was broken:


[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:2.5.1:compile (default-compile) on project hbase-server: Compilation failure

[ERROR] /x1/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/snapshot/ExportSnapshot.java:[165,65] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : method copyBytes()

[ERROR] location: class org.apache.hadoop.io.BytesWritable

[ERROR] -> [Help 1]

Addendum makes the compilation pass.
Thanks Ted Yu, can you commit the addendum? however getSize() is deprecated and I think it should be getLength() instead.

+1 on the addendum

We are always forgetting crusty Hadoop 1 whenever Jenkins is too snowed under to produce timely precommit builds. It's a shame we didn't declare 0.98 as Hadoop 2+ only, and I'm glad we did that for branch-1 and later.

Addendum modified as suggested.

Integrated to 0.98 branch.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #462 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/462/)
HBASE-11742 Addendum makes compilation on hadoop-1 pass (tedyu: rev 00a9cd3c342b59774e1068c705e454f94d861d14)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/snapshot/ExportSnapshot.java

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #435 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/435/)
HBASE-11742 Addendum makes compilation on hadoop-1 pass (tedyu: rev 00a9cd3c342b59774e1068c705e454f94d861d14)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/snapshot/ExportSnapshot.java

Esteban Gutierrez, can you elaborate why this needed to revert HBASE-11360? HBASE-11360 was an important fix.
It seems the idea of HBASE-11360 is still valid: Do not cache the contents of tmp files and instead retrieve them in bulk when requested.
Or is HBASE-11360 no longer needed anyway, since do not have 1000's of reference files, but a single manifest instead?

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
